channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for WA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for WA

item.title: Report X-2023080232
item.description:
Report X-2023080232

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-21T15:11:41+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-21
  • City: SPOKANE VALLEY
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE WAS PREPARED IMPROPERLY FOR TRANSPORT BY NOT HAVING CAPS TIGHTENED BEFORE BEING SENT OUT. WAS DISCOVERED LEAKING ON THE BELT, TRANSFERED TO RED LINED TOTE AND INSPECTED BY QA. DescribePack: LOOSE CAP, CAUSED 2 OZ OF LEAKAGE DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: TRANSFERED TO RED LINED TOTE, CAPS SCREWED ON.

Report E-2023080049

  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that that load had shifted during transit and that one of the poly 5 gallon can of orange extract (un1197) had been damaged by a sharp object and had released 1 liter of product. The warehouse crew was able to contain and cleanup the release, so no contractors were dispatched.

item.title: Report X-2023060794
item.description:
Report X-2023060794

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-19T00:29:19+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-30
  • City: BURLINGTON
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 05/30/2023 at approximately 0200, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 245617 at the station location in Burlington, reporting an undeclared flammable liquid spill. The shipment consisted of 1 plastic bottle of Arm-R-Seal, packed in a fiberboard box. The package raised suspicion because it displayed orientation arrows and made a liquid sound . The SDS found online by the agent classifies the commodity as UN 1263. The package was not prepared with the required markings, labeling, packaging and paperwork in accordance with IATA Regulations. The shipment is being held, pending an FAA investigation.

item.title: Report I-2023070029
item.description:
Report I-2023070029

  • Incident Date: 2022-11-04
  • City: Seattle

  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: YRC FREIGHT
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: While unloading the trailer, three batteries were found damaged and leaking. The release was properly managed. The damaged batteries were placed into a salvage drum and held pending disposition from the shipper.
